Package helper

Class Errors

java.lang.Object
helper.Errors
public abstract class Errors extends Object
Holds the methods for error checking throughout the application.

    • Errors

      public Errors()

  • Method Details

    • cancelConfirmation

      public static boolean cancelConfirmation()
      Confirms that the user wishes to cancel. Displays a confirmation alert asking the user if they want to cancel the current operation and lose any unsaved changes.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms the cancellation, false otherwise.

    • saveApptConfirmation

      public static boolean saveApptConfirmation(javafx.scene.control.TextField title, javafx.scene.control.TextField description, javafx.scene.control.TextField location, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Customer> customer, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker date, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> sHour, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> sMin, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> eHour, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> eMin, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Contact> contact, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Integer> user)
      Validates the customer information entered in the form. Displays an error message if any field is missing data and returns false, otherwise, returns true. One lambda expression is used to check whether a text field is empty. Another lambda expression is used to check if a ComboBox is null. This helps clean up the code used to generate error messages.
      Parameters:
      title - The TextField for the appointment title.
      description - The TextField for the appointment description.
      location - The TextField for the appointment location.
      customer - The ComboBox for the appointment customer.
      date - The DatePicker for the appointment date.
      sHour - The ComboBox for the appointment start hour.
      sMin - The ComboBox for the appointment start hour.
      eHour - The ComboBox for the appointment start hour.
      eMin - The ComboBox for the appointment start hour.
      contact - The ComboBox for the appointment contact.
      user - The ComboBox for the appointment user ID.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the appointment information is valid or not.

    • apptOverlap

      public static boolean apptOverlap(Appointments appt)
      Confirms that the proposed appointment doesn't overlap with another for the same customer. Displays an error message if the customer has another appointment at the same time.
      Parameters:
      appt - The appointment instance to be compared to existing appointments.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the customer has an overlapping appointment.

    • inBusinessHours

      public static boolean inBusinessHours(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)
      Confirms that the entered times are between 8am-5pm EST. Displays an error message if the proposed appointment time is outside of business hours. Returns true otherwise.
      Parameters:
      start - The LocalDateTime for the appointment start time.
      end - The LocalDateTime for the appointment end time.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating if the appointment is in business hours or not.

    • saveCustomerConfirmation

      public static boolean saveCustomerConfirmation(javafx.scene.control.TextField name, javafx.scene.control.TextField address, javafx.scene.control.TextField postalCode, javafx.scene.control.TextField phone, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Country> country, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Division> division)
      Validates the customer information entered in the form. Displays an error message if any field is missing data and returns false, otherwise, returns true.
      Parameters:
      name - The TextField for the customer's name.
      address - The TextField for the customer's address.
      postalCode - The TextField for the customer's postal code.
      phone - The TextField for the customer's phone number.
      country - The ComboBox for the customer's country.
      division - The ComboBox for the customer's state/province.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the customer information is valid or not.

    • customerHasAppointments

      public static void customerHasAppointments()
      Displays an error message indicating that the customer has associated appointments. User must delete customer appointments to continue.

    • upcomingAppointments

      public static void upcomingAppointments(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointments> appts)
      Displays a message when there are upcoming appointments within 15 minutes of the user logging into the application. If there are no upcoming appointments, the user will not receive a message.
      Parameters:
      appts - An ObservableList of all Appointment objects.
